result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyquanda J Mayfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Continue in cognitive thinking counseling. Pay ZCI fees. Restitution is held open. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyquanda J Mayfield

records.addlTxt: Terminated - regular
Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Tyquanda J Mayfield in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St-In 15CF871 Plea to count 1 & count 2 as amended. In 15CM1511 Plea to count 1.
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 & count 2 as amended in 15CF871 & count 1 in 15CM1511.

15CF871
Count 1- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Count 2- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

15CM1511
Count 1- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Conditions: 
Continue in cognitive thinking counseling
Maintain employment + continue in school 
20 hours of community service
Pay the balance of ZCI fees
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge on count 1 in 15CF871 only
Waive court costs in both files
Restitution is held open
Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation

BTC: Adj  Plea hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyquanda J Mayfield in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Requesting another status date.
BTC: Adj  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with victim stores Target, SELAH Beauty except for restitution purposes. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). If ZCI does not want to continue GPS, deft to do Day Reporting with ZCI. Exceptions are going to court and meeting with atty. 7-1-15 Defendant allowed to work at Burger King - Douglas Ave., to attend school at Computer Systems Institute in Gurnee, IL, to look for housing and meet with worker from Housing Authority of Racine Co. Defendant will provide work and school schedules to ZCI.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 11-20-2015:  ZCI reporting is removed as a condition of bond.**
